title: The Lincoln Project
added: The Lincoln Project prepared to sue Trump lawyer [[Rudy Giuliani]] for defamation after the former [[mayor of New York City]] claimed in a broadcast interview with [[Steve Bannon]] that the organization had planned the January 6 [[2021 storming of the United States Capitol|storming of the Capitol]]. Giuliani said he relied on an anonymous source and offered no evidence for his allegations. The Lincoln Project sent him a three-page letter on January 29, 2021, that read in part, “You committed a textbook act of defamation. You publicly accused The Lincoln Project of an infamous and criminal act that it had nothing to do with, as you very well know.” They demanded an apology by February 3.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Keller |first1=Aaron |title=Lincoln Project Pens Scathing Threat to Sue Rudy Giuliani: ‘You Were Once a Respected and Respectable Figure’ |url=https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/politics/lincoln-project-pens-scathing-threat-to-sue-rudy-giuliani-you-were-once-a-respected-and-respectable-figure/ar-BB1dfjTk?ocid=ob-fb-enus-1541512262291&fbclid=IwAR3nKfFZ2zDH4E1OX24jGiQUqrOwdssvEC1yG55k-tXIFfM1RTYmB15dExo |access-date=January 30, 2021 |work=msn.com |publisher=Law & Crime |date=January 30, 2021}}</ref>

title: The Lincoln Project
deleted: There have been several developments within the Lincoln Project, post-election, that has affected its internal operations.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Isenstadt |first1=Alex |title=The Lincoln Project implodes amid infighting and scandal |url=https://www.politico.com/news/2021/02/12/lincoln-project-scandal-468984 |access-date=15 February 2021 |work=POLITICO |language=en}}</ref> There has been sexual abuse cover-up allegations relating to founder John Weaver.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://apnews.com/article/donald-trump-33a03c2280fff515a09c4d51365cb83d|title=Young men accuse Lincoln Project co-founder of harassment|work=[[Associated Press]]|date=January 31, 2021|accessdate=January 31, 2021|author=The Associated Press}}</ref> Steve Schmidt resigned from the board in February 2020, to make way for a female board member, and in a statement apologized to Jenifer Horn for retweeting images of Twitter direct messages and elaborated on his own sexual abuse experience.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.thedailybeast.com/lincoln-project-co-founder-steve-schmidt-to-step-down|title=Lincoln Project Co-Founder Steve Schmidt Steps Down Amid Scandal|work=[[The Daily Beast]]|date=February 12, 2021|accessdate=February 12, 2021|author=Allison Quinn}}</ref> Founder George Conway called for investigation of the Lincoln Project, with Yahoo News describing Conway as calling for a "full public accounting of what its leaders knew about the sexual misconduct of one of its top officials as well as questions about the organization’s finances".<ref>{{cite news |title=George Conway: Lincoln Project must give 'full explanation of what happened' |url=https://news.yahoo.com/lincoln-project-co-founder-says-group-must-give-full-explanation-of-what-happened-161913752.html |access-date=15 February 2021 |work=news.yahoo.com}}</ref> On February 15, 2020, the Lincoln Project posted on their website that they had "retained the law firm of [[Paul Hastings]] to investigate allegations of inappropriate behavior by John Weaver", as well as claims of a toxic work environment, "as part of a comprehensive review of our operations and culture". Additionally, they said they are releasing current and former staff from any confidentiality provisions in employment agreements dealing with working conditions.<ref>{{cite web |title=Statement from the Lincoln Project {{!}} The Lincoln Project |url=https://lincolnproject.us/news/statement-from-the-lincoln-project-february-15-2021/ |website=The Lincoln Project |access-date=16 February 2021}}</ref>
